title: Add a login with the Firefox Password Manager
summary: How to add logins to Firefox using the password management page (about:logins)
html:
Firefox will automatically add and sync your logins if you've enabled logins sync (see How to perform Sync on Firefox desktop). You can also add logins to Firefox, if you prefer, by following these steps:

  1. Click the Firefox menu button and select Passwords.
    • The Firefox about:logins page will open.
  2. Click the Create New Login button at the bottom+ button next to the Search Logins box at the top left side of the about:logins page.
  3. Enter the website address, username and password for that site.
  4. Click Save.
  1. Click the Firefox menu button and select Passwords.
    • The Firefox about:logins page will open.
  2. Click the + button next to the Search Passwords box at the top left side of the page.
  3. Enter the website address, username and password for that site.
  4. Click .

To learn more about managing logins in Firefox, see Password Manager - Remember, delete and edit logins and passwords in Firefox.

Note: On macOS and Windows, OS authentication may be required when accessing stored passwords using Edit, Copy or (the reveal button, represented by an eye icon). This is not your Mozilla account credentials. See Secure Firefox passwords with device sign-in for more information.
